The screen emits canned laughter and miscellaneous chatter, while guests in the adjacent room can be seen conversing in clusters. David, still nibbling on a clam, listens as Holly and April offer reassurances from offscreen.

Checking his wristwatch, David is approached by Holly, who chuckles as he, impressed by something April said, walks over to her at the table. April also laughs as Holly reappears onscreen, busy preparing another tray of hors d'oeuvres. The trio exchange glances, and Holly shrugs nonchalantly.

The scene shifts to an exterior view of a contemporary red building designed by David, nestled between two older structures. The voices of Holly, April, and David are heard offscreen as the camera pans down from the buildings to show the trio seated in David's Jaguar parked across the street. David and April occupy the front seats, while Holly is squeezed into the back, her head slightly forward. David briefly turns to glance at Holly before refocusing on April.

The camera explores the ornate facade of a rococo building, then shifts to display the elegant building next to it. It then transitions to an ultra-modern structure adorned with tiny, diamond-shaped motifs, and further to its equally unappealing entrance. A large car is parked directly in front of this building.

The group is then seen descending the canopied entrance stairs of an apartment house on the opposite side of the street, from where they had been observing the contrasting facades. David leads the way, with the women following; Holly trails slightly behind April. As they reach the bottom, David leans over the roof of the car, looking at the women and awaiting their decision.
541:
Half of the boat has been reduced to splinters by the time the relentless blades draw nearer, their wind brushing against the necks of those aboard. In a critical moment, Indy seizes Kazim and leaps into a motorboat skillfully piloted by Elsa, which arrives just in the nick of time alongside the disintegrating vessel. As they stabilize, Kazim lifts his shirt to display a mark on his chest; it's either a birthmark or a tattoo, resembling a cruciform sword—a Christian cross that narrows like a broadsword's blade. The boat nears the canal's edge, prompting Kazim to disembark and walk away.

Close scrutiny is given to a water-soaked paper impression, a rubbing from the shield of the Grail Knight, by Brody, who simultaneously nurses a bump on his head with an ice pack. Dressed in a bathrobe, Indy leans in to examine the impression alongside him. Brody momentarily lowers the ice pack to glance at Indy before lifting the Grail Diary, which spans two pages of detailed entries. His finger traces the text as Indy, after closing the diary, slips it into his robe's pocket and proceeds to open his bedroom door, revealing a ransacked space with the mattress tossed to the floor and drawers emptied.

Concerned, Indy moves to Elsa's room, knocking before entering to find it similarly disturbed. Worried for her safety, he calls out and taps on the bathroom door. Upon opening it, he discovers Elsa, startled, in front of a mirror, clad in a silk bathrobe. As she reaches to switch off a record player perched above the bathtub, Indy steps back into her bedroom. Rejoining him in the disheveled room, Elsa looks around in disbelief and then at Indy, who retrieves the Grail Diary from his pocket. As she steps closer, her frustration peaks, and she stomps her foot before attempting to leave. Indy, however, pulls her close and kisses her passionately, leading to an exchange of affection that culminates with them falling onto the bed, their intimate moment underscored by the melodious singing of a gondolier passing their window.

Their romantic interlude is momentarily interrupted by the sound of the gondolier's song, but Elsa quickly pulls Indy back to her. Meanwhile, a Mercedes-Benz navigates the sharp curves of mountainous terrain, its journey superimposed over a map tracing a route from Venice through Austria towards Salzburg, under the increasingly ominous storm clouds.
544:
The movie begins with a Sinister Man clicking his heels and giving a swift bow. Brody, in response, removes his hat. The Sinister Man then turns and joins another man, whom Brody and Sallah decide to follow. As they trail, the Second Man overhears Sallah, prompting him and his companion to whirl around swiftly. Sallah, managing Brody's luggage, sets it down and exchanges a glance with Brody before patting his clothing in search of his papers. He then laughs and pulls out a newspaper instead. Brody appears confused by this action. Sallah proceeds to show the newspaper to the Second Man, using it to obscure the Second Man's face momentarily before delivering a surprise punch through the paper.

As this unfolds, Donovan leads Vogel away, trailed by Nazi Guards. Once they depart, Elsa turns her attention to Indy. She tenderly strokes his face. Meanwhile, Indy and his father Henry remain bound back-to-back. Elsa leans in close to Indy, her whisper reaching Henry's ear as well. She then plants a passionate kiss on Indy's lips, much to Henry's visible disappointment. Vogel soon reappears to remind Elsa of her duties, prompting her departure, though he lingers a moment longer. In a sudden move, Vogel delivers a brutal punch to Indy's jaw, snapping his head aside.

In their predicament, Indy and Henry frantically attempt to loosen their ropes. Henry manages to maneuver his hand close to Indy's coat pocket, while Indy tries to twist his body towards Henry's reaching fingers. Henry successfully opens a lighter and ignites it, but the flame burns his hand, causing him to yelp and drop the lighter. Desperate, Henry kicks at the lighter on the floor, but fails to reach it. The discarded lighter begins to smolder the rug. As they turn their heads to watch, Indy continues his struggle against the ropes. In his efforts, his foot inadvertently strikes a metal grill, triggering the opening of a Secret Door.

Behind this door, a Nazi Radioman, equipped with headphones, is stationed at a complex panel of dials, switches, and meters, while a Woman plots coordinates on a map. Both have their backs turned to Indy and Henry, who remain tied inside a fireplace. Indy's foot again hits the grill, causing it to open further. Inside, four Nazi Radiomen and the Woman continue their work unperturbed until the Woman notices Indy and Henry. Her scream alerts the others, who draw their guns just as Indy manages to free himself. The Radiomen activate a lever and begin to move through the Secret Door, entering the fireplace but finding no trace of Indy and Henry, who have concealed themselves up the chimney.

From their hiding spot, Indy and Henry suddenly drop down behind the Radiomen. In the ensuing chaos, one of the Radiomen seizes Indy by the neck. Their struggle leads them against the rotating wall, and they tumble through to the next room, leaving a startled Henry behind in the fireplace.
545:
In a tense moment, Henry presses against a wall that rotates, leading him into the next room where he encounters a dead Nazi radioman who swivels into view. Other Nazis quickly rush to the scene. Meanwhile, Indy seizes a bust of Hitler and wedges it into the rotating wall, effectively trapping the Nazis within the inferno of the room.

Vogel, with purpose in his stride, advances down a hallway, issuing a sharp command that prompts two additional Nazis to join him. Indy grabs his whip, his leather sack, and Henry's case from a nearby table, handing the case to Henry before they both sprint away. They enter an empty room where Henry, visibly horrified by their predicament, watches as Indy frantically searches for an escape route by running his hands over the walls.

In a sudden twist, Henry sits on a chair that tips backward, striking the wall and triggering the floor beneath Indy to drop away. Indy clings to a railing but ultimately loses his grip, plummeting down a newly formed spiral staircase. Henry follows him down the winding steps, which lead them into a vast watery cavern beneath the mountain that supports the castle. Inside this cavern, they discover a fully operational Nazi boat dock bustling with motorboats, gunboats, and supply boats.

Indy quickly boards a motorboat, starts the engine, and is met with Henry throwing his case at him. In a heated moment, Indy catches the case and tosses it back to his father before returning to the dock to push the boat away. Henry appears confused by the rapid turn of events. Not far behind, Vogel and his Nazi soldiers enter the room, spot the spiral staircase, and hurriedly descend to the dock below. Upon arrival, Vogel notices that a motorboat is missing and immediately orders his soldiers into another boat.

The scene shifts abruptly as a motorbike screeches to a halt. In a moment of frustration, Henry slaps Indy across the face. Nearby, a sign with arrows pointing to Venice and Berlin catches their attention, and the camera focuses on the direction toward Berlin. They proceed to a Nazi rally where a massive book-burning is underway, the pile of burning books reaching ten feet high and growing larger as college students and Nazi Brownshirts continuously feed it. The atmosphere is charged with the rhythmic waving of flags, banners, and swastika standards, contributing to the escalating frenzy of the crowd.

Indy and Henry approach the square, with Indy disguised in a Nazi soldier's uniform, which is oversized and requires buttoning up. They move toward an area where high-ranking officers of the Third Reich, flanking Adolf Hitler, oversee the rally with a commanding presence.
551:
In the heat of battle, a soldier leaps from a truck onto a tank, brandishing a knife as he seizes Indy. The two men engage in a fierce struggle, tumbling off the tank. Dazed, Indy sits up only to find Vogel towering over him, menacingly wrapping a chain around his neck. Moments later, Indy reappears at the tank's entrance, the chain still constricting his neck, with Vogel yanking him back forcefully.

As a Nazi Soldier approaches, Indy strikes him, sending him crashing onto the tank treads. The soldier's screams pierce the air as he is horrifically dragged under the tank's relentless wheels. Amidst this chaos, Indy and Vogel continue their brutal contest on top of the moving tank, the chain still a tight noose around Indy's neck. In a desperate move, Indy lifts his feet and lunges at the tank's periscope, dragging Vogel with him. Indy's face is momentarily pressed against the periscope's lens, which another Nazi Soldier observes from the other side, pulling away briefly with a smile before resuming his watch.

Vogel pulls Indy away from the periscope, and the observing soldier looks away once more. Meanwhile, a troop truck approaches the tank. From within the tank, Henry fires its gun, obliterating the truck and sending soldiers flying through the air. The truck flips and explodes, the blast propelling Indy off the tank and onto its tread. He quickly grabs onto a shredded gun jutting from the tank's side. Above him, Vogel looks down and smirks arrogantly. The tank hurtles toward a cliff wall.

As Indy attempts to find secure footing, Vogel maliciously stomps on his hands. Inside the tank, Brody exchanges a glance with Henry. Outside, Vogel now swings a shovel at Indy, fiercely targeting his hands. Brody and Henry climb out of the tank but are confronted by another Nazi Soldier who pulls Henry back down. Vogel, relentless, raises the shovel and smashes it down on Indy, who is still clinging to the protruding gun. Indy's grip fails, and he hangs perilously from the gun, supported only by the strap of his leather pouch.

As the tank scrapes against the cliff wall, stones tumble over Indy, and he screams in agony. Back inside the tank, the Nazi Soldier knocks Henry into a pile of boxes and punches him in the face. As he aims his gun at Henry, Brody intervenes, striking the soldier with a canister. The soldier collapses, his gun discharging into the air. The bullet ricochets wildly inside the tank, sparking and pinging off the window, narrowly missing the Tank Driver at the controls before passing through his hat. Blood trickles from beneath the hat as the driver slumps forward, his body pressing down on the levers.

Outside, Indy remains suspended by the strap of his leather pouch as the tank swerves, narrowly avoiding rocks and causing Vogel to lose his footing and fall.
552:
Indy, after a struggle, finally hoists himself back onto the tank and forcefully knocks Vogel off the side with a punch. He then looks down to see Henry still trapped inside the tank. Indy swiftly pulls both Henry and Brody out of the vehicle. However, Vogel, now armed again with a shovel, climbs back onto the tank and swings at Indy. Indy dodges the attack, grabs Vogel's arm, and in the process of winding up for another punch, accidentally hits Brody in the face with a backswing before successfully knocking Vogel down. Vogel's hat then flies off and lands on the floor.

Before Indy can react further, Vogel is up again and swinging his shovel. Indy ducks, but the shovel hits Henry, knocking him off the side and onto the tank's moving treads. Indy quickly grabs his whip, knocking Vogel aside, and as Henry speeds perilously towards the front of the tank, Indy, with incredible agility, lashes out his bullwhip, snagging Henry's right ankle just in time.

Sallah, riding alongside on his horse, tips his fez to Henry in a respectful gesture. Meanwhile, Vogel punches Indy from behind and tries to choke him, but Indy steadfastly holds onto the whip. Sallah reaches out to Henry, manages to grab him, and skillfully brings his horse to a stop right at the cliff's edge.

Indy frees himself from Vogel's grip by twisting his arm away painfully and then delivers a decisive blow to Vogel's head. As he looks down at the fast-approaching cliff, horror fills Indy's face. His hat is blown off and sails over the cliff's edge. The tank, moments later, tumbles over the cliff and crashes to the bottom, exploding into a fiery wreck. Henry, Brody, and Sallah gaze down at the flaming remains. Indy, looking dazed and bewildered, staggers up behind them, joining them at the cliff's edge to look down at the wreckage below, his expression filled with bewilderment.

Henry finally notices Indy's presence, overcome with emotion, and throws his arms around him. Indy, feeling his father's embrace, hugs him back. Brody and Sallah are moved by this sudden reconciliation. Henry pats Indy on the back, and Indy, overwhelmed, collapses and sits hard on the rocky cliff edge. Unaware, Henry, Sallah, and Brody start to walk away, with Henry turning towards a horse with Brody and Sallah. Suddenly, a fedora, carried by the wind, blows into the scene and lands at Indy's feet.

Meanwhile, Donovan, peering through binoculars, views the Canyon of the Crescent Moon. He lowers the binoculars and turns to Elsa, who then takes her turn to look through them. Indy, Henry, Sallah, and Brody ride into the canyon and, after turning a corner, they come upon the sight of the hidden city.
555:
As agony twists his face, he clutches his stomach and turns toward Elsa. Suddenly, he begins to age rapidly; his hair lengthens, turns gray, and becomes brittle. Shocked, Elsa gasps and screams. His skin transforms into a brown, leathery texture, stretching tightly over his bones until it splits. With skeletal hands, he reaches out and chokes Elsa. Indy swiftly intervenes, shoving the man away. As he falls, his body ignites in flames and shatters against the wall.

Indy then examines an assortment of chalices and selects a simple earthenware jug. He exchanges a significant look with Elsa before heading to the well to fill the jug with water. He pauses momentarily, then brings the jug to his lips, taking several large swallows. Together, Indy and Elsa approach with the Grail, astonishing the two Nazi soldiers who stand in awe.

Kneeling beside Henry, Indy tilts his head forward and holds the Grail to his lips. Weak and unable to open his eyes, Henry manages to swallow some of the water, though much of it trickles down the sides of his mouth. Indy then pours the water over Henry's wound, and as everyone watches in amazement, the wound and the bloodstain vanish. Color floods back into Henry's face, and his eyes open. The first sight that greets him is the Grail, sparking joy in his eyes, which intensifies when his gaze shifts to Indy's face.

The Nazi soldiers, overwhelmed, rush forward, drop their weapons, and surrender by raising their arms. Elsa steps forward, picks up the Grail, and her face glows with its possession. She moves to the edge of the Great Seal, but a rumbling sound fills the air as the ground shakes and shifts, causing dirt to fall from the cavern's ceiling. Elsa stumbles on the Great Seal, and the Grail slips from her grasp. As she reaches for it, the ground beneath her splits open, and she slides into the crevasse. Indy catches one of her hands as he slides forward across the slanted floor. Desperately, Elsa reaches for the Grail with her free hand, but Indy needs both her hands to save her. As her grip begins to slip, the ledge Indy lies on starts to break apart. Henry grabs one of Indy's hands, while Indy reaches for the Grail with the other. Realizing the peril, Indy abandons the Grail and grabs Henry with both hands, who then pulls him to safety.

Through the falling debris, Sallah and Brody rush out from the crumbling Temple, seeking safety.
557:
In a cluttered study filled with books, Professor Henry Jones is deeply engrossed at his desk, studying an ancient parchment volume that lies open before him. The page reveals a beautifully illuminated picture, resembling a stained-glass window, complete with a series of Roman numerals. Not merely observing, Professor Jones meticulously copies the image into his notebook, his hand deftly sketching until he pauses, holding up one finger in thought. As he stands to leave, closing the study door behind him, the sound of a trumpet playing interrupts the quiet. Herman, still blowing into the instrument, enters through the front door. Indy, reaching out, forcefully pulls the trumpet from Herman’s mouth, only to receive a spit in the face in response. Moments later, the Sheriff, meant by Herman, enters the house. Indy, in an attempt to make a point, hands over what appears to be a Cross to the Sheriff, who takes it nonchalantly.

Soon after, Fedora, accompanied by Roscoe, Rough Rider, and Halfbreed, steps into the house. Fedora respectfully removes his hat and holds it in his hand. In a coordinated move, the Sheriff hands the Cross to Fedora, who promptly has it taken by Roscoe. Roscoe then dashes out the door with the Cross. Fedora lingers briefly, turning to speak to Indy with an ironic, man-to-man tone before placing his hat, a symbol of respect and admiration, onto Indy’s head. The hat covers Indy's face, its brim eventually filling the screen. As the brim lifts, it reveals the face of the now full-grown Indiana Jones.

Suddenly, Indiana Jones is punched in the face, his arms pinned behind him. The Man in the Panama Hat, aged since their last encounter, removes the Cross of Coronado from Indy's belt. It's night, and rain pours down amidst a violent storm at sea. Thirty-foot waves crash across the deck where two Portuguese sailors, holding Indy’s arms, push him toward the rail. As they pass a bundle of fuel drums, Indy uses the sailors for leverage, kicking up his feet to break the clamp on the metal bands holding the drums. He then jabs his elbows into the sailors’ stomachs, breaking free to rush towards the Man in the Panama Hat. Seeing Indy's approach, the Man in the Panama Hat hurries up a ladder towards the bridge. Despite the crashing waves, Indy pursues, catching up to the ladder where the Man in the Panama Hat is climbing. Indy successfully reclaims the Cross from him, only for a sailor to deliver a powerful blow to Indy's face, causing the Cross to fly from his grip and skitter across the deck.
559:
Donovan confidently strides across the room towards Indy, exuding power in his tuxedo. He extends his hand for a firm handshake with Indy. Moving to a nearby table, Donovan dramatically unveils a cloth-covered object, revealing a flat stone tablet approximately two feet square. The tablet, inscribed with ancient letters and symbols, catches Donovan's keen interest as he dons his glasses for a meticulous examination. As Indy peruses the tablet, Donovan pours champagne into several fluted glasses. Suddenly, Indy pauses, his expression startled as he looks up at Donovan. Accepting a glass of champagne from Donovan, Indy rubs his chin, his face reflecting doubt.

At the mention of his father, Indy stiffens slightly but nods in acknowledgment. The atmosphere shifts as Mrs. Donovan, a matronly figure adorned in an opulent evening gown, enters the room. Donovan greets her affectionately with a kiss on the cheek. Mrs. Donovan, perhaps feeling out of place, sighs softly and rejoins the ongoing party. Meanwhile, Indy's attention is recaptured by the Grail Tablet, his interest piqued by its archaeological significance. Using his champagne-moistened finger, he gently rubs the surface of the tablet. Donovan steps closer to Indy, whose expression conveys disapproval at Donovan's seemingly reckless approach.

Producing an ancient, leather-bound volume with brittle pages, Donovan presents it to Indy, who examines the manuscript with notable interest. The scene shifts as a Ford coupe races down a tree-lined street, pulling up in front of a house. Indy quickly exits the vehicle and hurries up the walkway, followed closely by Brody. Noticing the front door ajar, they exchange concerned glances before entering. Indy approaches the partially open door, pushing it further to step inside and call out.

Inside, Indy pulls back one curtain separating the hall from the sitting room, revealing the ransacked state of the house. Brody, observing Indy's reaction, opens the other curtain. They move into the room, where Brody picks up some mail from Henry's cluttered desk. Indy spots a pile of torn papers and envelopes. Prompted by this, he empties his own pockets, revealing mail collected earlier from his college office, and discovers an envelope with a Venice postmark.

Continuing his investigation, Indy finds a small book that appears to be a journal or diary, filled with handwritten notes and sketches. Brody peers at it with great curiosity. As Indy ponders aloud, he turns to a painting on the wall depicting Christ on the Cross, with His blood being collected in a golden chalice. Nearby, another painting shows Eleventh Century Crusaders falling to their deaths off a high cliff, except for one who safely floats in midair, holding the Grail in his hands.
561:
In a tense moment within a library, a man named Indy blows dust off a tile and attempts to dislodge it, but initially fails. He then hastily moves past Brody, rushing to a brass stand positioned under a stained-glass window. With precise timing, Indy lifts the brass stand and strikes the tile just as the Librarian stamps a book, catching the Librarian's attention and sparking his curiosity about the echoing sound.

Despite the Librarian's puzzled looks and continued stamping, Indy relentlessly pounds at the tile until it finally breaks apart. Bending down to clear away the fragments, Indy uncovers a two-foot square hole. Impressed by Elsa's daring spirit, Indy cooperatively holds her hands and lowers her into the hole. Once her feet touch the ground below, Indy releases his grip on her and discreetly hands the Grail Diary to Brody before descending into the hole himself.

Inside, Indy jumps down a steep step and reaches back to assist Elsa. Together, they survey their dimly lit, damp surroundings. Elsa pulls out a cigarette lighter adorned with an ivory four-leaf clover design. Using this, they examine markings etched into the walls. Indy borrows the lighter to lead them through a dark passageway.

Meanwhile, three armed men, including Kazim, descend a spiral staircase toward an unsuspecting Brody. Kazim violently strikes Brody on the head with his gun. Indy, with a quick glance at the situation, takes the lighter and leads Elsa into another dark corridor. He touches the wall, running his hand over the stone surface, before forcefully ramming his shoulder into it. The wall gives way, collapsing as Indy tumbles into another room, landing amidst rocks surrounded by a bubbling, green, slimy liquid. Skeletons rest in carved niches around him.

Elsa, holding the lighter, peers through the newly formed hole in the wall at Indy. He reaches up, tearing a piece of cloth from one of the skeletons, which disintegrates and falls into the oily water below. Indy fashions a makeshift torch from the cloth and a bone, dipping it into the oil-slick water to light it. Guided by this torch, Indy and Elsa navigate a narrow passageway filled with knee-deep water teeming with rats. The rodents crawl over each other, thrashing in the water, causing Elsa to gasp as they scamper between her legs. As Indy advances through the rat-infested water with Elsa following, still gasping in horror, he suddenly slips into a hole. Quickly regaining his balance, he reaches out to Elsa for support.
565:
Edgar forcefully pushes Laurel out through the driver's door of the cab, closely following her while maintaining his weapon's aim on her. Left behind on the front seat, the postcard he has been carrying now reveals its front. Meanwhile, Jay urgently lifts the plastic cover and decisively presses the red flashing button. As the LTD accelerates toward the looming traffic jam, it undergoes a transformation, morphing into a larger, more wiry machine, its structure supported by an intricate network of mechanical muscles and metallic tendons.

Kay's vehicle, now transformed, hurtles dangerously close to a fatal collision with the traffic jam but miraculously veers off at the last second with a distinct sucking sound emanating from beneath. Instead of crashing into the tunnel wall, the LTD astonishingly adheres to it. It maneuvers upward onto the wall, clings there, and races past the traffic below. Continuing its astonishing journey, it flips over completely and drives upside down, its wheels gripping the tunnel's roof. Jay, dislodged from his seat with a loud clunk, finds himself on the car's inverted ceiling. Curled up and peering out the window, he watches as they speed through the tunnel, zooming over the congested traffic beneath.

Edgar momentarily loses his hold on Laurel, and she seizes the opportunity to hurl herself out into the air. Edgar's desperate flailing fails to reach her as she tumbles through the air and lands amidst the branches of a tree. She strikes the branches hard, causing them to shake, and desperately clings to them, suspended high above the ground. Above her, Edgar continues his relentless climb.

At the fairgrounds, the LTD comes to a long, skidding halt near a fence. At the trunk, Jay and Kay hurriedly open it and grab the most lethal-looking weapons they can find. Kay snatches a black box, unsnaps a series of latches, and opens it to unveil a formidable, three-foot-long, triple-barreled shotgun with an over-and-under-and-under configuration, equipped with a pump action reloader and a storage clip for twelve additional, steel-glistening shells. Kay methodically loads the clip.

Suddenly, a vacuum whump sound, akin to all the surrounding air being sucked into a dime-sized space, erupts, followed by a massive shock wave emanating from the gun barrels. The bizarre force sends Jay and Kay crashing to the ground onto their stomachs as if pulled by a magnetic force. The shock waves ripple across the open space toward the ship, and upon impact, the ship, too, is forcefully pulled back down.
566:
As six additional Men in Black, clad in dark suits and sunglasses, emerge over the hill, Agent Kay swiftly issues them commands. He then brandishes a neuralyzer, capturing the attention of the Agents who examine it intently. Kay, donning his own sunglasses, activates the device with a button press, unleashing a blinding flash that lasts a mere tenth of a second, leaving the Agents momentarily disoriented and staring blankly.

In the aftermath, Kay points out the Men in Black using fire extinguishers to extinguish fires they had previously ignited. Amidst the confusion, the Agents look around bewildered. Meanwhile, Dee, having distanced himself from the group, sits on a rock, gazing at the starry night sky, his sunglasses hanging loosely from his hand. Kay approaches, joins him on the rock, and shares a moment of silence as they both look up at the countless stars above. Kay then retrieves his neuralyzer, examining it thoughtfully.

The scene shifts to James Edwards, a New York City cop dressed in undercover street clothes, racing ahead of two other officers struggling to keep pace. Edwards, demonstrating superior speed, is hot on the trail of a man, later identified as the Perpetrator, whose feet are seen sprinting across the screen. Their chase leads them onto a bridge crossing Park Avenue in the low Forties.

The Perpetrator suddenly veers left and, without hesitation, leaps over a guard rail into a thirty-foot drop to Forty-first Street below. Edwards, taken aback but quick to react, follows suit, landing on a double-decker tourist bus crammed with Japanese tourists, many of whom are filming the incident. Pushing through the crowd, Edwards flashes his badge, poised to arrest the Perpetrator.

Just as Edwards is about to handcuff him, the Perpetrator blinks, momentarily distracting Edwards. This brief hesitation allows the Perpetrator to draw a bizarre-looking weapon. Edwards swiftly knocks the gun from his hand, causing it to crash against Central Park's stone wall and shatter into countless fragments. The Perpetrator retaliates by kicking Edwards in the groin, then quickly gets up and resumes his escape. Edwards, in pain, staggers after him.

The chase continues as the Perpetrator leaps over a moving car, heading towards the Guggenheim Museum. Edwards attempts to pursue, but a bus obstructs his path. By the time it passes, the Perpetrator has vanished from sight.
567:
The Perp, having leapt an impressive twenty feet, soared past a bystander and landed on the roof of the Guggenheim. He scrambled up, crunching onto the gravel surface, then dashed to the front door of the Museum. He shot the lock and burst inside, running up the grand ramp of the rotunda. Desperately, he leapt to his feet and raced to a nearby door, but found it locked. He tugged at another door—also locked. In a frantic move, he scrambled up and over a ledge to a third door, which swung open to reveal EDWARDS, breathing heavily and aiming his weapon at the Perp. After a tense moment of decision, the Perp plummeted to his death, screaming as he fell.

Meanwhile, Edgar, every bit the nasty, bug-eyed redneck his voice suggested, carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun, stumbled across his yard in shock. His mouth agape, he stared at the smoldering remains of his truck, a huge hole extending ten feet into the ground.

In another scene, a woman, DOCTOR LAUREL WEAVER, in her thirties with a dark aura about her, looking as if she had just been dragged from bed after encountering a spaceman, sneaked into a room. She whispered to someone, casting a cautious glance over her shoulder. Edwards, twisting in his chair for a better view, only saw Laurel facing someone in the hallway. As the person spoke, Laurel stepped forward, moving out of Edwards's sight. Stretching further in his seat, Edwards was suddenly blinded by a flash from the corridor. Intensely curious, he started to rise but was interrupted by KAY, who entered the room and shut the door behind him.

Edwards paused as he approached the door, only to be met by the INSPECTOR, who peeked in, smiled, and gave him a thumbs up. Edwards looked between the Inspector and Kay, then followed as Kay opened the car door and stepped out. They found themselves in front of a pawn shop. Inside, Edwards casually knocked some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs paled with fear. Kay then drew his gun, aiming it at Jeebs' forehead. Seeing Kay's progress, Edwards joined in the action. Suddenly, with a loud KA-BOOM, Kay shot Jeebs, whose head exploded and body crumpled to the floor.
571:
The LTD comes to a halt at the end of the driveway leading to Beatrice's farmhouse, the site where the alien ship had previously landed. Nearby, a wrecked pickup truck remains stationary. JAY and KAY exit the vehicle, their demeanor that of undercover cops. JAY begins to walk up the driveway, while KAY retrieves a black card from his wallet, presenting it to Beatrice as she approaches. Beatrice appears revitalized since their last encounter, sporting nicer clothes, a hint of makeup, and a smile.

Inside the farmhouse, in the living room, JAY takes a sip of Beatrice's lemonade and grimaces slightly. A soft giggle escapes Beatrice as she recalls a pleasant thought. Meanwhile, in the hole left by the landed ship, KAY is busy investigating. He uses a pocket spectral analyzer over a patch of scorched earth. Above, JAY leans over, peering down at KAY, who looks up at him. The analyzer's display shifts through colors—red, yellow, purple, and finally green.

Suddenly, DR. LAUREL WEAVER, previously seen attempting to speak with JAY, appears. She signs a clipboard and gives JAY a disapproving look, which he responds to with laughter before departing. Laurel then moves to a stretcher, gently petting Rosenberg's cat. She notices JAY and KAY standing nearby, rises, and approaches the Arquillian's body, which is laid out on a table under bright lights. She pulls back a sheet, unveiling the fully dissected Arquillian to JAY and KAY.

JAY starts examining the Arquillian while Laurel and JAY move across the room to Rosenberg's corpse, which lies on another gurney. Laurel snaps on a rubber glove and reaches down, out of view, manipulating the insides of the body. JAY's expression reveals his disgust at the sight. From the opposite side of the room, KAY clears his throat and walks over to continue examining the Arquillian. JAY rushes back to join Laurel.

JAY leans in closer to Rosenberg's corpse and notices unusual stitching around the base of his ear. He touches the ear and turns it, hearing a soft sound as it detaches from the head. Inside, a gravely wounded Tiny Little Green Man is revealed. JAY pulls further, causing Rosenberg's face to mechanically hum and hinge open, revealing a control room inside the skull filled with gearshifts and viewing screens. A Baltian, controlling the body, staggers out of the control room, nodding vigorously in acknowledgment before nodding again, falling, and succumbing to death.

Meanwhile, KAY and JAY are distracted and fail to notice Laurel. Without even glancing her way, KAY swiftly uses his neuralyzer to erase her memory with a flash.
584:
As the plane levels out, Trina is thrown across the galley. The aircraft's gauges plummet as the pilot, Whip, maneuvers the aircraft towards a church on a vast open field. In a close call, Whip steers clear of the church's steeple, yet the wing clips it. The plane then crashes onto the ground. Debris flies past the cockpit, striking Whip's head and rendering him unconscious.

Regaining semi-consciousness with blurred vision, Whip sees Ken slumped in his seat being dragged out of the wreckage. Nearby, Margaret lies dead beside Trina, her head fatally crushed by a fallen bulkhead. As Whip is pulled from the wreckage, smoke obstructs his view while individuals in white robes assist the other passengers. A fire engine soon arrives on the scene. Whip, now on the ground, looks up to see a female EMT attending to him before turning his gaze to the black smoke emanating from the crash site. The church's spire, broken off during the incident, lies at a distance where an ambulance operates and rescue workers aid survivors.

In the hospital, Whip, with his right eye slowly opening and the other covered by a bandage, watches a TV where a man gestures and rescue workers move a stretcher past. A Channel 12 News reporter gives a live commentary from the crash site, with lights flickering in the background. On the television, cell phone footage captures the plane's descent, showing it swerving, slicing off the church's steeple, flying overhead with both engines ablaze, and finally crashing onto its side as people in white robes scatter for safety.

Wrapped in gauze, Whip watches in a daze as the church congregation stands, observing the aftermath before slowly approaching. Averting his eyes from the screen, he notices a man in the room, intently focused on his cell phone, dressed in a suit with the collar open. Whip smiles as the man, Charlie, turns towards him. Soon after, an NTSB officer, accompanied by law enforcement, a nurse, and a doctor, enters the room. The NTSB officer sets a recorder on Whip's bed, to which Whip gives a weak nod. The doctor and the others, including the NTSB officer named Craig, leave the room, but Charlie remains. Charlie smiles and reaches for a plastic bag before departing.

Overwhelmed, Whip covers his mouth with his bandaged hand, tears streaming down his face. Shaking his head, he retrieves his cell phone from the plastic bag and drops it onto his stomach. Meanwhile, a heavy-set man with a goatee, clad in Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires visible, enters the hospital. Carrying a bag in hand and another over his shoulder, he strides down the corridors, eventually stopping at the reception desk to remove his earphones and lean forward to speak.
586:
A man opens a freezer, discovers a bottle of vodka, and promptly pours it down the sink. He then removes a bulging plastic trash bag from the trash can and carries it outside to a shed. Upon sliding open the shed doors, he unveils a two-seat Cessna plane housed within a small hangar. He removes a blanket covering the plane's windshield and activates the lights. His gaze then shifts to a collection of photographs displayed above a workstation in the hangar, where he delicately extracts a photo of a young African American boy from a frame and kisses it affectionately.

Later, he pulls a bottle of liquor from a bowling bag and discards it. He holds a framed wedding photo of himself and his wife, reminiscing for a moment before settling down to watch the news that evening. The following day, at a hotel lobby, the man, named Whip, walks with a cane; his large eye patch is gone, replaced by visible stitches around his eye. He proceeds to a dining area where a buffet is set up and approaches Charlie, who is seated with another man wearing glasses. Hugh, at the table, peruses a file while Whip examines a document in front of him, his eyes narrowing in concentration before he decides to leave. Stopping briefly in the bar area, Whip notices his photo displayed on the TV behind the bar.

Seating himself at the bar, Whip manipulates a cocktail napkin and scrutinizes a glass of vodka. He lifts the glass, takes a sip, smacks his lips appreciatively, then drains the rest of the contents. Later, he places a case of Budweiser on the passenger seat of his car, gets in, unscrews a gallon bottle of vodka, looks around cautiously, and begins to chug it. Groggy-eyed and clutching a beer can, Whip drives down a street until he reaches a dead-end and halts. He observes Nicole loading items into the back of a car, briefly looks away, then watches her run back through a worn fence.

Whip drives up to the apartment entrance right behind Nicole's car, passing her belongings and noticing a few enlarged photographs in a basket. He takes a sip of his beer, suddenly alert, and proceeds towards the apartment. Inside, he forcefully pushes Fran to the floor. A brief exchange follows where Nicole nods in acknowledgment, and Whip takes out some money, looking at Nicole for a moment before nodding in agreement.

Seated in the passenger seat of Whip's car as he drives and drinks his beer, Nicole bites her thumb nervously. When offered a beer by Whip, she refuses. Whip lights a cigarette, and Nicole, fidgeting slightly, smiles to herself as she observes him driving.
590:
Whip surveys the assortment of spirits and opts for vodka. While still kneeling, he removes the bottle's cap, feeling the cold glass beneath his fingers. He sniffs the vodka, then replaces the cap, stands up leisurely, and places the bottle atop the refrigerator before shutting the door and departing. Later, he snatches the bottle back up.

Elsewhere, Charlie steps out of an elevator with three coffees in hand, followed by Hugh. Edmonds gives a knock, prompting the men to exchange glances. Hugh checks the time as they observe bottles scattered everywhere.

In the bathroom, Whip lies face down beside the toilet, surrounded by a large blood stain. Harling arrives with a bag over his shoulder, causing Hugh to jump back and Charlie to raise his hands. Harling motions towards Edmonds. Hugh clears a space on the table, and Harling takes a seat beside Whip, cutting cocaine as Whip smiles up at him. A piece of toilet paper with a blood spot hangs over Whip's eye.

Hugh fetches water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip drinks and Harling, after sucking on the cigarette, passes it to Whip. Harling continues to cut more lines of cocaine, snorts one, and offers it to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods in acknowledgment.

Whip heads into the bathroom, and Harling dons his sunglasses. Whip exits the room sporting sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and wearing a suit. Charlie and Hugh trail him into an elevator where they join a woman and a little girl. The girl stares at Whip as Hugh passes him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back and presses the cloth to his nostril, then removes his glasses to check his reflection on the elevator's ceiling before lowering his gaze to the little girl.

In the hearing room, cell phone footage of a plane crash plays on a large screen until it concludes. Whip shifts uncomfortably in his seat and sips water. Ellen, managing the proceedings, presses a remote, stands up, and circles the table at the front of the room. She projects an image onto two massive screens and faces Whip in the center of the room. Wearing her glasses, Ellen reviews her notes as Whip exchanges glances with Hugh and Charlie. The evidence flashes across the screens while Ellen nods and flips through a file. Charlie and Hugh exchange a look.

Whip's attention fixes on an enlarged photograph of Katerina displayed on the screen. He rolls his tongue, his gaze momentarily meeting Hugh and Charlie's before returning to Katerina's smiling face, his lips pressed together. He takes another sip of water as Ellen nods. Whip looks firmly at Ellen, his face glistening with sweat. His eyes feel heavy as he looks down. Ellen closes her file and walks slowly back to her seat.
593:
In the infirmary, a visibly anxious Slughorn occupies a chair. Ron, finally regaining consciousness, sits up only to weakly slump back onto the floor. Ginny and Hermione are stationed beside Ron's bed, where Madam Pomfrey diligently monitors his temperature. As a contingent of staff, including McGonagall, Dumbledore, and Snape, enter the room, Harry turns to watch them. Lavender bursts in, quickly noticing Hermione at Ron's side. Leaning closer to observe, Lavender's face hardens before she dashes out of the room, just as Hermione reassuringly takes Ron's hand. The professors soon depart, followed by Ginny's attention shifting to Harry. Madam Pomfrey exits next, leaving Hermione to catch Harry's eye; they share a subtle smile before Harry, the last to leave, exits the ward. Hermione, now seated on Ron's bed, tightens her grip on his hand, exhaling a sigh of contentment.

Meanwhile, the silhouette of someone ascending stairs is projected against a wall. Harry, ascending the spiral staircase, glimpses through an archway to identify Draco Malfoy. He moves closer, observes briefly, then tails Draco. Draco proceeds along the upper corridor, where a birdcage, now holding only one bird, is suspended. He pauses, closes his eyes, and when Harry reaches the corner, Draco has vanished. Inside a cluttered room, Draco is seen with a heavy cloth from a cabinet, also holding the missing bird. He encloses the bird within the cabinet, plucking a feather from his cuff and examining it under the light. Upon reopening the cabinet, the bird has disappeared. Later, rain drenches the Borgin and Burkes shop sign. Through a grimy arched window at the back, a faint light illuminates a triangular cabinet, securely shut. Draco, nervously, opens his cabinet to discover the bird dead inside. He stares at its motionless form, his face contorted in a frown, then breaks down in sobs.

In the great hall, Lavender fixes a stern gaze on Ron, who sits beside Hermione, clutching his wand as snowflakes begin to flutter down. Ron appears confused as he, along with Hermione and Harry, notice Lavender lifting her chin and clenching her teeth in defiance. Harry's eyes dart between Ron and Hermione, observing their reactions. Hermione averts her gaze downward.

Harry, reading a note scribbled in his advanced potion book, suddenly rises to his feet, grabs the book, and strides purposefully up the hall towards Katie. She peers over his shoulder, her gaze fixed. Turning, Harry catches sight of Draco watching them. Draco retreats, turns away, and exits as Harry follows suit. Katie departs with a friend as Harry marches determinedly down the great hall. Draco ascends the stairs, while Harry pushes through a cluster of students, not far behind. Draco briskly walks the upstairs corridor, passing the now-empty birdcage, and hurries into the boys' lavatory. There, he loosens his tie, removes his sweater, turns on a tap, and scrutinizes his distressed reflection in the mirror.
594:
Harry's disheveled hair frames his face as he splashes water on his ashen complexion. From the doorway, he observes Draco sobbing. Suddenly, Draco draws his wand and casts a spell, prompting an immediate response from Harry. Draco casts another spell as they both seek cover behind the cubicles. Draco briefly appears, then ducks back out of sight. Harry cautiously peeks out, catching his reflection in a mirror. The two of them crawl across the floor, peeking underneath the cubicles. Draco's spell misses its mark. Rising, Harry aims his wand at Draco, who stumbles backward and falls into water pooling on the floor from a burst pipe. With his potions book in one hand and his wand in the other, Harry slowly walks past the cubicles. Rounding a corner, he finds Draco sprawled on his back. Shocked, Harry stumbles forward, noticing blood seeping into the water and staining Draco's white shirt. Snape strides in, brushing past Harry to stand over Draco. He glares at Harry, who averts his gaze and leaves. Snape kneels beside Draco; the blood recedes and the stains on his shirt disappear.

In the Gryffindor common room, Harry's potions book lies on the table before him. Silhouetted against the light from a lead-paned window, Ginny, Hermione, and Ron stand. Ginny approaches and sits beside Harry, who nods in acknowledgment. Standing in front of the unicorn tapestry, Harry firmly grasps Ginny's outstretched hand. They enter a cluttered room, their reflections visible in the mirror behind them. Wandering through the Room of Requirement, they hear a sound from a cabinet covered with heavy cloth. As Harry approaches, he notices a gap in the cloth where he sees a door. A bird flies out and lands on a stone shelf. Harry gazes at Ginny as she moves close to him, and they share a long look. She glances at his book, taking it from his hand. Harry keeps looking at her as she steps back, and he closes his eyes, standing rooted to the spot, breathing shallowly. Swallowing hard, he keeps his eyes shut. Ginny returns, steps close to Harry, and gently kisses him on the lips. He responds, then smiles and opens his eyes, but Ginny has disappeared. Lost in thought, Harry walks slowly down a corridor. Ron approaches as Professor Slughorn stops in front of them and then hurries away.

Back in the common room, under the watchful eyes of Hermione and Ron, Harry uncorks a vial of Liquid Luck and drinks its contents. As he stares into the distance, they stand and look at him. Harry grins and turns to them as he passes other students. Hermione and Ron appear confused. Meanwhile, a greenhouse window is forced open, and Slughorn's head appears.
596:
The movie begins with waves forcefully crashing against a towering pinnacle and the rugged coastline. This scene is reminiscent of the craggy cliff depicted on Tom Riddle's postcard. Dark clouds loom ominously in the background while spray and spume are flung over the area. Dumbledore, his hair and beard wildly tossed by the fierce wind, keeps his gaze fixed on an inverted V-shaped fissure in the cliff face.

Inside a rocky cavern, Dumbledore sharpens a knife against a stone before decisively piercing his own right hand with it. Harry, witnessing the act, looks at the wound with concern. Dumbledore then smears his bloodied hand across the rock face, causing it to crumble. Stepping back to join Harry, they observe the effect. With their wands serving as torches, they proceed into a tunnel that was previously hidden.

As they advance, they reach a lake, gazing out over its dark surface where their wands' reflections shimmer. Dumbledore sends a ball of light skimming across the lake; it rises, falls, and then flares brightly, revealing a small island in the distance. He steps onto a half-submerged crystalline rock and extends his left hand over the water, which begins to bubble and churn. Something stirs within the frothy waters, and suddenly a chain leaps into Dumbledore's grasp. He hands the chain to Harry, who starts pulling, and soon the carved prow of a small boat emerges from the water. With greater vigor, Harry hauls the boat towards them.

The boat slowly transports them across the still water to the island. Upon reaching it, they climb onto the translucent rock. There, a dip in a rock pedestal holds a crystal basin filled with a shimmering liquid. Dumbledore passes his hand over the surface, then, startled, looks up. He uses a large shell as a cup to scoop up the liquid and drinks it, shuddering as he opens his eyes after draining it. Weakened, Dumbledore steps back from the basin and sits down with difficulty, covering his ear with his now blackened right hand.

Harry takes over, picking up the shell and returning to the basin to scoop more liquid. He assists Dumbledore in drinking, filling the shell repeatedly and persistently forcing the liquid into Dumbledore's mouth. As the basin nears emptiness, Dumbledore, with half-closed eyes, reluctantly opens his mouth to accept more liquid. Finally, with the basin almost empty, Dumbledore opens his eyes wide and smacks his lips, while Harry steps back holding the empty shell.

Harry then returns to the basin, where he finds and lifts a locket and chain lying at the bottom, subsequently raising his wand in readiness.
597:
Water fills a basin as Harry, in desperation, tries to scoop it with a shell that refuses to fill. Turning away, he gazes at the nearby lake, then stumbles over rocks toward the water. Bracing himself with a rock, he stretches down with the shell. Meanwhile, Dumbledore's ball of light descends beneath the surface, plunging them into darkness. Harry, wielding his wand, makes its tip glow. Clenching his teeth and using the hand that steadies him on the rock, he leans forward to dip the shell into the lake, filling it to the brim. Suddenly, a bony hand emerges from the water, grabbing his arm. Harry wrestles free as the water around the island begins to seethe ominously. The light intensifies, revealing emaciated corpses crawling from the water toward him. He strikes out at them as they swarm the small island. Dumbledore, in a feeble attempt, reaches for his wand. Harry is dragged under the water, where a corpse wraps its arms around him from behind. As they sink, Harry sees balls of fire streaking through the water above. The creature releases him, allowing Harry to surface inside a circle of fire. Dumbledore stands, flourishing his wand around his head to whip up the flames, causing the corpses to retreat. Harry returns to the island and assists Dumbledore back to their boat. The flames part, revealing a clear channel of water ahead.

In another scene, Draco Malfoy lies awake in bed before rising. The lights at Borgin and Burkes shop go out as Bellatrix leads a group through the courtyard to a room at the rear. She opens the door of an embossed cabinet. Meanwhile, Filch stands guard on the school's battlements. Draco marches unnoticed through a corridor while Professor McGonagall leans out of a stone archway, anxiously scanning the menacing clouds above. Snape also looks out into the brewing storm. In the Room of Requirement, Draco removes a heavy cloth from a cabinet, steps back, and observes as the door handle turns and the cabinet opens, releasing black smoke. Draco quickly walks away as Bellatrix, Greyback, and two Death Eaters with metal masks emerge from the smoke. Bellatrix smirks.

At the astronomy tower, Harry walks away but stops, turning to look back at Dumbledore. He hides as a figure passes on the stairs, climbing to the upper platform and pointing a wand at Dumbledore. Harry watches from below as Draco reveals the Death Eater mark on his arm. Dumbledore's wand falls, and Harry, still concealed, sees Bellatrix, Greyback, and the two Death Eaters race to the upper platform. Bellatrix faces Dumbledore while Draco keeps his wand raised. Snape, unnoticed by Harry, is right behind him and then enters the upper platform.
599:
Upon entering a house, Dumbledore, gripping his wand in his unscathed left hand, and Harry discover chaos: the front door is dislodged from its hinges, the house is in disarray, pictures hang askew, and a door frame bears scratches. As they proceed into the sitting room, they find the furniture overturned and the room utterly ravaged. 

Harry, engrossed in examining a piece of paper, is startled when a drop of blood falls onto it. Looking up, he notices the ceiling where plaster has crumbled, exposing bloodied rafters, and feels another drop land on his forehead. Dumbledore delicately wipes the blood from Harry's forehead and tastes it, his gaze sweeping the room suspiciously. His attention is drawn to an overstuffed armchair; he approaches it cautiously, followed by Harry, and probes it with his wand, revealing a man in disguise who spots Harry.

With a swift motion of his wand, Dumbledore begins restoring the room. Shards of glass fly towards a broken chandelier, which magically reassembles and rehangs itself. A vinyl disk finds its way back to a record player, books return to their shelves, and a grand piano corrects itself. The ceiling repairs itself, the missing plaster regenerating, prompting a smile from Harry, who then notices a piece of the chandelier under his shoe. He lifts his foot, and the piece soars to its proper place.

In the now tidied room, Horace Slughorn, dressed in pajamas made from upholstery fabric, grins at Harry. Harry then moves to a display of moving photographs, watching as some figures within raise their glasses in a toast. As Dumbledore departs, Harry exchanges a glance with Slughorn before following him out.

Walking down the path, they are soon joined by Slughorn. In the street, Dumbledore extends his arm, and Harry, bracing himself, prepares to apparate. A cloud of dust marks their departure, and Harry finds himself alone, landing in a stream. Shaking off water from his trainers, he trudges through a reed bed until he spots the familiar Weasley house, a smile forming on his face as he sees Ginny at an upstairs window. She comes downstairs, spots his trunk and white owl, and rushes to him on the stairs. They share a warm embrace, their eyes locked as they pull apart. Hermione then rushes up, and Ron tenderly touches her cheek, as Harry observes them both with interest.

The trio later gathers, sitting on the floor around a tray placed on a stool.

Meanwhile, in a grim and wet part of town, Narcissa Malfoy, accompanied by Bellatrix Lestrange, navigates a narrow alley. They pause to let children on bicycles pass before Narcissa steps onto a street and knocks on a door. The two women stand in the rain, waiting until Wormtail, a round-faced man, greets them at the door and ushers them into Severus Snape's study.
601:
Harry rises from his seat. He retrieves an item from the overhead luggage rack, exits the compartment, and proceeds down the corridor, concealing the item behind him. Outside, the train chugs through an expansive, sunlit brown landscape as evening sets in. Harry pauses to allow two girls to pass and notices Draco in a carriage with open seating on either side. A contemplative expression crosses Harry's face as he glances at the Peruvian Darkness Powder in his hand. Abruptly, darkness envelops the carriage.

Summoned by Pansy and Blaise, a sullen boy with closely cropped hair, Draco takes a seat opposite them. He catches sight of his briefcase subtly moving on the luggage rack. Meanwhile, on the Hogwarts platform, Hagrid stands, swinging a lantern as the train arrives, its headlight piercing the gloom. Pansy and Blaise, waiting for Draco, finally exit their compartment, as do Ron and Hermione.

Draco retrieves his briefcase from the luggage rack and moves toward the door to the next carriage, sliding it shut and pulling down the blind, causing all the blinds to close. An object falls from the rack and crashes to the floor. Draco removes the invisibility cloak, revealing Harry, frozen and staring. Draco stamps on the immobilized Harry, then covers him again with the cloak and exits the carriage. He steps onto the nearly empty platform, glancing around as he walks away, steam rising behind him.

Someone walks through the train, viewing it as if through a rose-tinted kaleidoscope, with pink and mauve shapes swirling. The carriage door opens, revealing Luna, donned in blue and white Spectrespecs as advertised in the Quibbler. She observes a cloud of silvery dust hovering above the floor, prompting her to draw her wand. She removes the invisibility cloak, and Harry breaks free from the immobility spell. Luna lifts her specs. Harry's nose is broken and bleeding.

They arrive at the school gates, where Flitwick installs an invisible shield. Luna and Harry watch as Draco forcefully takes his walking stick from Filch. Draco notices Harry and smirks before walking away, followed by Snape who turns on his heel. Luna raises her wand, and Harry's swollen, misshapen nose returns to normal, though blood remains on his upper lip, chin, and t-shirt.

In the Great Hall, Ron eagerly consumes jelly and cream, only to be struck by Hermione with a book. Harry approaches them. Dumbledore ascends to the lectern, adorned with a gilded owl that stretches its wings. Ginny gently wipes the blood from Harry's face. Professor Slughorn, dressed in a gown and mortarboard, acknowledges the applause. Amidst the celebrating Slytherins, Draco stares blankly ahead, lost in thought, his chin resting on his hand. The other students exchange glances as Draco remains seated.
602:
In the corridor of Hogwarts, Professor McGonagall is seen standing solemnly. Nearby, Harry Potter and Ron Weasley share a moment of laughter against a wall before Harry parts from Ron to approach McGonagall, who responds with a shake of her head.

The scene shifts to a potions class where the atmosphere is tense with activity. A student eagerly raises a hand as another steps toward the potions area. Harry, curious, opens a cupboard door and carefully places a lid on a container, prompting nearby girls to step back in caution. Draco Malfoy watches with keen interest as students struggle with their assignments; Ron attempts to slice a Sopophorous bean, which first rolls away and then shoots into the air upon his second try. Seamus Finnigan makes a bold stab at his bean, while Professor Slughorn impressively catches one midair. Even the usually proficient Hermione Granger faces difficulties. Harry, taking guidance from handwritten notes in his book, successfully drips juice into his cauldron, contrasting with the struggles of others like Crabbe and Goyle, who see no success. Seamus's cauldron suddenly flares up, blackening his face, while Harry continues to follow the notes, achieving success by adding a clear liquid. A girl's cauldron spills green slime onto the table, and Hermione grows increasingly frustrated. Professor Slughorn, impressed by Harry's work, drops a leaf into Harry's brewing pot and leads the class in applause, though Draco and his Slytherin companions remain unimpressed and do not join in.

Later, in his study, Professor Dumbledore examines a book with a burnt hole, into which he places a ring before closing the book and stowing it away in a drawer. Dumbledore then turns his attention to a cabinet filled with vials, from which he selects one. Harry, handling it delicately, takes the vial to a Pensieve—a shallow, hovering metal basin—and with a nod from Dumbledore, pours its contents into the basin. Dumbledore dims the lights with a flick of his hand as Harry immerses his face into the basin, surrounded by wispy trails of black smoke.

Within the Pensieve, Harry witnesses a scene on a street leading to a large building. A figure with an umbrella marches toward it, and a younger Dumbledore enters a room where an 11-year-old boy, Tom, sits at a table and stares at him with a frown. Dumbledore touches a wardrobe, in front of which shells and pebbles line a window's edge alongside a postcard of a craggy coastline. Suddenly, the wardrobe by the door bursts into flames, and Tom retrieves a metal box from it, extracting small toys. As Dumbledore moves away from the sullen Tom, he pauses, and swirling black smoke envelops the image of the boy. Harry withdraws his face from the Pensieve, taking deep breaths and staring resolutely ahead.

The tranquility is shattered as Death Eaters charge through the clouds toward Hogwarts, only to be repelled by an invisible shield. In a shadowy corridor within the castle, two birds in a cage hang as Draco Malfoy walks past them toward a wall adorned with a tapestry of a unicorn.
603:
In a cluttered room, Draco Malfoy pauses, his gaze sweeping the space as he idly tosses an apple. The creak of wood draws his attention, and he turns to see the source. With a determined tug, he pulls down a heavy cloth, unveiling a tall, triangular cabinet reminiscent of one from Borgin and Burkes. Draco inspects this cabinet meticulously.

Meanwhile, at the Quidditch stadium, a lone student soars overhead. Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley stand together, overseeing the Gryffindor trials. The aspiring players turn their attention to Harry and Ginny. Among the hopefuls, Ron Weasley stands rigidly, adorned in a protective leather helmet. From the stands, Hermione Granger offers a wave of encouragement. Cormac McLaggen saunters over to Ron, casually slapping his arm before strutting away, leaving Ron visibly downcast. Cormac takes to the air, confidently flying towards a circular goalpost, while Ron nearly slips from his broom as he maneuvers towards the opposing goal. Lavender Brown watches Ron intently. Cormac catches Hermione's eye, smirking, while she looks away briefly before stealing another glance.

The trials commence amidst the excitement. Two players collide in mid-air and plummet. Ginny, wielding a round leather Quaffle, aims it at Cormac's goal. With agile moves, Cormac punches the Quaffle away with his right hand, kicks another aside, and punches a third with his left. He then secures the next Quaffle. It's Ron's turn to defend his goal; he flails wildly, punching and kicking to deflect shots, but a Quaffle ultimately unseats him, leaving him dangling precariously from his broomstick. Lavender jumps to her feet, cheering for Ron, who manages to regain his seat on the broomstick. Hermione watches as Ron clings on anxiously. Two Chasers zip past Harry, and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione mutters a spell into her hand, smiling as Cormac is suddenly jerked sideways, allowing the Quaffle to sail past him and through the goal. Another Quaffle is aimed at Ron, who swings helplessly; it strikes his head and bounces away.

Later, in the Gryffindor common room, Hermione makes a face. Ron looks over at Lavender, who waves at him, but then glares back. Harry closes a book and stands up, only for Ginny to snatch it from him. Hermione and Ginny fix their gazes on Harry, who shifts uncomfortably. Ginny tosses the book back to him, and he exits the room, watched by both girls. In his room, Harry sits at a table, the book open before him, its pages covered in scribbled notes.

Walking through the snow, the trio encounters Professor Flitwick. They enter The Three Broomsticks, where Harry spots Draco Malfoy leaving. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, while Hermione observes them as well. Ginny and Dean share a kiss at their corner table. Ron turns to Harry, his jaw clenched and a scowl on his face. Leaning on the table, Ron raises his eyebrows and glances at Hermione, then points to his upper lip. Hermione, realizing she has butterbeer froth on her lip, wipes it off with her sleeve and gazes at Ron.

On their way back, Leanne and Katie Bell walk ahead of the trio.
605:
In a gripping Quidditch match, Gryffindor players skillfully maneuvered the Quaffle, dodging opponents until one player launched it towards the goal. Swiftly, Ron Weasley, Gryffindor's goalkeeper, dove to block the shot, thrilling his supporters who erupted in joy. Amidst the aerial battle, Ron tirelessly thwarted numerous Slytherin assaults. From the stands, Hermione Granger, though skeptical, couldn't help but watch the game unfold.

Gryffindor then shifted to an offensive strategy. A Slytherin Beater attempted to knock a Bludger towards a Gryffindor player but missed, resulting in the Beater being thrown off his broom. As Gryffindor scored, their fans cheered loudly, prompting a fierce counterattack from Slytherin in a V formation. The Quaffle raced towards the goal, only for Ron to make another spectacular save. Triumphantly, he raised his right fist and basked in the adulation of the chanting crowd. Hermione offered a faint smile.

Balanced perfectly on his broom, Ron celebrated by raising both arms in victory. Later, in the Gryffindor common room, he stood on a table as red confetti rained down on him. Harry Potter showed Hermione an unopened vial of Liquid Luck, shaking his head at her questioning look. The celebration was briefly interrupted when Lavender Brown threw her arms around Ron, kissing him passionately. Harry couldn't help but grin, while Hermione, standing beside him, took a deep breath. As the kiss lingered, Hermione turned sharply and left the room. Harry noticed her departure and followed.

In a dimly lit corridor, Harry heard sobbing. Descending a spiral staircase, he spotted Hermione sitting on the bottom step, weeping. His shadow loomed large on the wall as he approached her. Charm birds fluttered around Hermione as she looked up at Harry, who sat down beside her, offering silent support.

Meanwhile, Ron and Lavender dashed into a cloister. Lavender tried to pull Ron away, but Hermione, her expression hardened, stood up. Suddenly, the birds attacked Ron, who fled in panic. The birds crashed into a wooden door, leaving a mess of feathers. Ron, alarmed, glanced back at Hermione before walking away. Hermione slumped back onto the step, eventually leaning her head on Harry's shoulder. Harry, feeling awkward, gently placed his hand on her arm.

The party continued, but Ron and Lavender, absent from the festivities, ran up a staircase, pausing by a tall window to kiss passionately. Elsewhere, Draco Malfoy stood alone on the astronomy tower, leaning on the balustrade and gazing over Hogwarts as snow gently covered the school's spires and roofs. The cloisters were adorned with festive greenery.

Amidst the holiday decorations, a raven-haired girl smiled, and Luna Lovegood, dressed elegantly in a knee-length tiered dress of pale pink silk with chiffon ruffles around the neckline, skirt, and sleeves, was escorted by Harry. They walked past a window bay where Draco sat, lost in thought. His expression stern, Draco later walked through an upstairs corridor, stopping momentarily. Closing his eyes, he entered a cluttered room, removed a heavy cloth from a cabinet, opened it, placed an apple inside, and then reopened it to find the apple vanished.
607:
A young blond boy, cross-legged, watches a black and white show on a large wooden TV set. At an awards ceremony, guests applaud a movie clip on screen. Nearby, a man sits quietly. Sophie, slender and stunningly beautiful, is announced by a woman on stage. Gobsmacked, Sophie sits beside someone as Sidney, beaming, claps enthusiastically. Shapely, raven-haired Sophie then rises from her seat. Sidney turns to face the camera. From a nearby table, a smartly dressed man and woman stand up. Camera phone images capture Ricky Gervais. Sidney stands by a red rope barrier, leading a pig. He grins as a nervous woman lifts the barrier for him, and Alison leads Sidney and the pig away to the Haymarket Hotel. Disguised as a waiter with a fake mustache, Sidney enters the party, obscuring his face with a tray of canapes, sneaking past a strict woman with a clipboard. His pig, Britney, wags her curly tail and eagerly snaps up a canape tossed by Sidney. By the pool, Sidney chats with Thandie Newton, sipping champagne. Thandie smiles coyly, then bursts into laughter and pats Sidney on the thigh. She gives him a sultry look, and he responds with a grin and a bashful sigh that disturbs his fake mustache, prompting a frown from Thandie.

Meanwhile, the brown-haired hotel manager knocks on Sidney's room door and enters to find the room trashed: chocolates and booze bottles litter the floor near an open fridge, with upturned furniture scattered around. Unseen, Britney trots out of the hotel room, scurries down a corridor to a lift, and the electric doors close. Thandie continues to flirt with Sidney, smiling flirtatiously. Britney, wandering out of the lift, urinates on a lady's red high heels. The PR Nazi pushes through the crowd, and Sidney spots Britney. Thandie stands as bouncers approach, and Sidney scampers away. The PR Nazi watches hawkishly as Thandie shrugs and two bouncers give chase. A woman is pushed aside during the commotion. Sidney takes a running jump, and a photographer captures the moment mid-flight. A photo in a newspaper shows Clint Eastwood with Sidney in a headlock at a postmodern review event.

Back at his busy living room turned office, Sidney, holding a lit cigarette, hears the phone ringing and staff arguing next door. A cover of the postmodern review criticizes Sharp's editor while writers gather in a frenzy to watch a brewing fight. Women cause a ruckus, flipping over a fax machine. An airplane soars through the blue sky. At night, Sidney, in a taxi, gazes wide-eyed at a theater's entrance sign. He cruises through Chinatown, but his smile fades upon seeing a helicopter.
616:
In Sydney's red brick building, sunlight bathes the exterior as inside, he prepares a hearty breakfast in the kitchen. Alison enters, draped in his oversized pajamas, and massages her neck while her gaze lingers on a black and white photo that Richard had been examining earlier. Sydney returns his attention to the stove, continuing his cooking, as Alison takes her place at the table, eyeing the spread of bacon, sausage, eggs, tomatoes, beans, and toast. Suddenly, she dashes away, covering her mouth.

In the living room, Sydney fluffs a cushion on his leather sofa and retrieves his father's book from the coffee table, inadvertently knocking Alison's handbag to the floor. Its contents spill out, prompting him to hastily gather them. Among the items, he notices Alison's red notebook, adorned with a gold butterfly emblem. With a furtive glance, he opens it and begins to read, only to look up and find Alison observing him. She shrugs nonchalantly and sits down, starting to collect her belongings from the table.

The melody from the soundtrack of La Dolce Vita fills the room as Alison, holding the record, looks up with a smile. Sydney takes the worn sleeve from her, and as he places the record on the player, she closes her eyes and smiles. With a wry smile, Sydney begins to dance and extends his hand to Alison, leading them into a dance. As they move, Sydney's attractive mother seems to watch from a photograph on the shelving unit. Alison, with a mischievous grin, joins Sydney in a playful jive. He lifts her hand high above his head in the dance.

The building, nestled amidst lush greenery and surrounded by crumbling apartment blocks, appears small in comparison to the looming skyscrapers on the horizon. At her workplace, Alison sits at her desk while Ingrid presents various dresses to another model. Sydney, eavesdropping at the door, quickly escapes through a fire exit upon hearing Alison's approach, inadvertently triggering the alarm. He closes the door behind him and turns to see a crowd of office workers gathering, which then disperses, leaving Alison to watch him as he walks away. He taps a sign on the door before pulling a wildlife book from a shelf.

In his bathroom, Sydney faces the mirror and applies white face paint, inserting fake fangs and donning a cape. He wrinkles his nose at his reflection before heading out with a glass of wine, encountering Elena, who is costumed as Marlene Dietrich and engaged in conversation. Sydney moves on, observing a person dressed as Elvis Presley kissing someone in a nun's habit. He approaches Alison, now wearing a black wig and smoking a long cigarette. Sydney removes his fangs as Lawrence hands Alison a glass of champagne, kisses her cheek, and then walks away, leaving Sydney to shift uncomfortably and shake his head. They both sip their drinks, staring ahead, until Sydney looks at Alison and sighs.
621:
As she ascends the steps to the Lorings' front door, she meticulously smooths the hem of her skirt that covers her jeans. She then peeks through one of the two oval leaded windows. Inside, she presents an image to Mark, who momentarily seems to drift away into the music before his eyes lock with Juno's. Juno notices a VHS nearby. Mark swiftly grabs the tape from her, and together they watch the chilling scene of a sinister man driving a stake through a woman's stomach.

Later, Juno displays the picture to Vanessa, who meticulously examines it both lengthwise and sideways. Vanessa casts a glance at Mark, receiving a harsh shrug in response. Standing rigidly with her arms tightly folded, Vanessa receives a tight-lipped smile from her husband as he places Juno's bag on her shoulder and opens the door for her departure. By the time Juno reaches home, the night has fallen, and she sips from a drinks carton. Inside, Bren is focused on cutting out pictures of dogs. As Bren returns to her paper dogs, Juno pours the remaining drink into Bren's ornament.

Outside on the snowy street, Juno halts the Previa and slips off her grey overskirt. Bleeker's mother opens her front door, but Juno races up the stairs, outpacing Bleeker's mother to reach Bleeker's room first. Bleeker reaches for a box, and Juno eases into a chair, legs spread apart. She then slides onto the floor next to him, both looking away in awkward silence. Suddenly, Juno's mood shifts to gloom.

Back at her home, Vanessa, dressed in an old T-shirt and her hair pulled back into a ponytail, stands before a bare wall. Mark, next to her with folded arms, also looks glum. Vanessa, nervously playing with the chain around her neck, turns to face the wall behind her, while Mark stares at it bleakly.

Juno and Leah are at the mall, crouching behind a glass balcony. In the mall play area, Vanessa is playfully engaging with a friend's little girl. Leah sucks in her cheeks, then stands and looks away, but Juno remains, watching Vanessa interact with the child. A soft smile graces Juno's face. They then approach Vanessa, who shakes her head in awe. Juno winces slightly before placing Vanessa's hand on her belly. Vanessa, her beautiful sculpted face tightening self-consciously, shakes her head again. Dropping to her knees in front of Juno, Vanessa nervously glances around before placing her hands on Juno's belly, her eyes widening with excitement. Juno, standing above her, watches Vanessa with a mixture of fondness and pride, as Vanessa gazes at the swollen belly with adoration.

Finally, at home, Bren works at her sewing machine, cutting the top of a pair of jeans and attaching an elasticated band, a satisfied smile crossing her face as she tests the elasticity.
622:
Juno, adorned in her adapted jeans, descends the school steps. Her hands are buried deep within the pockets of her oversized tartan parker. As she advances, her fellow students, fixated on her protruding belly, instinctively part to create a pathway for her.

Meanwhile, at home, Mark is engrossed in composing music. In the school canteen, amidst the quiet of an empty school awards booth, two girls consume their lunch. Leah, one of them, gazes with adoration at the chubby, bearded teacher nearby.

At his locker, Bleeker recoils slightly. Juno, visibly pregnant, waddles over to him, locking eyes with him intensely. Bleeker's gaze flickers nervously, glancing towards Katrina before his head droops in desolation. Juno, with her canvas bag slung over her shoulder, strides away decisively, leaving Bleeker to watch her departure with a sullen expression.

Hoisting herself into her dad's Previa, Juno applies some lip balm and starts the engine. At that moment, Mark, distracted by his computer screen, notices the blue van arriving outside his house. Juno follows Mark down to a cluttered basement room where she reads a title. Her hands then reach for his waist, and he guides them up to his neck. Embracing, with his hands around her waist and her belly pressed against him, they sway slowly together. Juno closes her eyes, resting her head on his chest, while Mark, his chin grazing her hair, appears unsettled. Startled, Juno looks up, staring at him in bewilderment.

In the midst of this, Vanessa, burdened with shopping, enters her immaculate white kitchen. Mark averts his eyes. Sensing the need to leave, Juno begins to depart, eventually bolting out the door. Clutching her belly, she waddles back to the Previa. Mark, in his rock T-shirt layered over a long-sleeved undershirt, gives Vanessa a cold look before retreating to his room. Vanessa, overwhelmed, sinks onto the stairs, her gaze lost in unhappy thoughts.

Under a cloudy sky, Juno drives beneath a road bridge, passing a freight train. She veers off onto the soft shoulder next to a field of dull green grass, speckled with patches of spring snow. Overcome by emotion, she strokes her belly and succumbs to tears. Crammed behind the wheel, seemingly oblivious to the traffic around her, she continues to rub her belly beneath her thick tartan coat, her eyes fixed ahead on nothing in particular. Gradually, she starts to calm down. The car lights flash as she merges back onto the road and drives away.

Up in his room after dark, Bleeker strums his guitar.
